div.head:
Catching nightingales
See the 15th folio after this
div.ab: For trapping them, one needs to observe their nature, the food that they like the best, & the season of their pleasure. The nightingale, as long as it sings, maintains a territory for itself alone. Therefore approach, making as if searching the ground for something. And taking some worms which come from old meal or from beneath kneading troughs or mills, which the nightingale is fond of, put some on your hat attached with a pin or otherwise, in order that it wiggles. And at five or six paces from the hedge where it sings, make a hole in the ground & put in some worms and your device of little crossed sticks. It will be anxious for you to leave so it can go see what you have done, and seeing worms, it will enter.
The coolness of the evening and the morning, near fountains & shaded places, are more appropriate for taking them.
